segment.source: Info about where features went in the IEAK11, where the Favorites, Command, and Status bars went, and where the search bar went.
segment.target: Info about where features went in the IEAK11, where the Favorites, Command, and Status bars went, and where the search bar went.

segment.source: User interface problems with Internet Explorer 11 (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: User interface problems with Internet Explorer 11 (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: User interface problems with Internet Explorer 11
segment.target: User interface problems with Internet Explorer 11

segment.source: Some of the features in both Internet Explorer 11 and IEAK 11 have moved around.
segment.target: Some of the features in both Internet Explorer 11 and IEAK 11 have moved around.

segment.source: Here are some of the more common changes.
segment.target: Here are some of the more common changes.

segment.source: Where did features go in the Internet Explorer Customization Wizard 11?
segment.target: Where did features go in the Internet Explorer Customization Wizard 11?

segment.source: Various installation or set up choices can prevent you from seeing certain pages in the Internet Explorer Customization Wizard 11.
segment.target: Various installation or set up choices can prevent you from seeing certain pages in the Internet Explorer Customization Wizard 11.

segment.source: If, after going through the entire Wizard you still haven't found the screen you were looking for, try:
segment.target: If, after going through the entire Wizard you still haven't found the screen you were looking for, try:

segment.source: Making sure you picked the right version of IEAK 11 during installation.
segment.target: Making sure you picked the right version of IEAK 11 during installation.

segment.source: Most administrators should pick the Internal version, which has more screens and options available.
segment.target: Most administrators should pick the Internal version, which has more screens and options available.

segment.source: Making sure you picked all of the features you wanted from the Feature Selection page of the IE Customization Wizard 11.
segment.target: Making sure you picked all of the features you wanted from the Feature Selection page of the IE Customization Wizard 11.

segment.source: If you don't pick a feature, the associated page won't appear.
segment.target: If you don't pick a feature, the associated page won't appear.

segment.source: Where are the security zone settings?
segment.target: Where are the security zone settings?

segment.source: You can see your security zone settings by opening Internet Explorer for the desktop, clicking Internet Options from the Tools menu, and then clicking Security.
segment.target: You can see your security zone settings by opening Internet Explorer for the desktop, clicking Internet Options from the Tools menu, and then clicking Security.

segment.source: Where did the Favorites, Command, and Status bars go?
segment.target: Where did the Favorites, Command, and Status bars go?

segment.source: For IE11, the UI has been changed to provide just the controls needed to support essential functionality, hiding anything considered non-essential, such as the Favorites Bar, Command Bar, Menu Bar, and Status Bar.
segment.target: For IE11, the UI has been changed to provide just the controls needed to support essential functionality, hiding anything considered non-essential, such as the Favorites Bar, Command Bar, Menu Bar, and Status Bar.

segment.source: This is intended to help focus users on the content of the page, rather than the browser itself.
segment.target: This is intended to help focus users on the content of the page, rather than the browser itself.

segment.source: However, if you want these bars to appear, you can turn them back on using Group Policy settings.
segment.target: However, if you want these bars to appear, you can turn them back on using Group Policy settings.

segment.source: To turn the toolbars back on
segment.target: To turn the toolbars back on

segment.source: Right click in the IE toolbar heading and choose to turn on the Command bar, Favorites bar, and Status bar from the menu.
segment.target: Right click in the IE toolbar heading and choose to turn on the Command bar, Favorites bar, and Status bar from the menu.

segment.source: -OR-
segment.target: -OR-

segment.source: In IE, press ALT+V to show the View menu, press T to enter the Toolbars menu, and then press:
segment.target: In IE, press ALT+V to show the View menu, press T to enter the Toolbars menu, and then press:

segment.source: Where did the search box go?
segment.target: Where did the search box go?

segment.source: IE11 uses the One Box feature, which lets users type search terms directly into the Address bar.
segment.target: IE11 uses the One Box feature, which lets users type search terms directly into the Address bar.

segment.source: Any text entered into the Address bar that doesn't appear to be a URL is automatically sent to the currently selected search provider.
segment.target: Any text entered into the Address bar that doesn't appear to be a URL is automatically sent to the currently selected search provider.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Depending on how you've set up your intranet search, the text entry might resolve to an intranet site.
segment.target: Depending on how you've set up your intranet search, the text entry might resolve to an intranet site.

segment.source: For more information about this, see Intranet problems with Internet Explorer 11.
segment.target: For more information about this, see Intranet problems with Internet Explorer 11.
